name: conserver
description: Allows multiple users to watch a serial console at the same time

repo.name: conserver
repo.description: Logged, multi-user access to device consoles

readme.summary: Clear overview of purpose but lacks practical usage examples and detailed setup instructions in the README itself.
readme.top_issue: No quick start or usage examples in README - users must read external man pages to understand how to actually use the tool

injection_risks.description: The putenv function is used with user-controlled input (optarg), which could potentially lead to environment variable injection.
The atoi function is used with user-controlled input (slash_posn + 1), but the impact of this is likely limited.

critical_findings: Potential environment variable injection in autologin/main.c
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential environment variable injection and lack of input validation, but no critical secrets or error exposure issues were found.

common_complaints: Critical stability issues (buffer overflow, signal 6 crashes)
SSL/TLS connectivity problems on newer systems (Rocky Linux)
Build configuration issues and compilation failures
Missing configuration options for production deployments
Lack of test infrastructure for cross-compilation
sentiment.summary: Conserver shows signs of poor maintenance with critical unresolved bugs (crashes, SSL errors) dating back to 2021-2022, recent feature requests going unanswered, and no visible maintainer engagement on open issues.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are generally clear and helpful, showing patience with new contributors.

concerns: No commits in the past 6 months
No merged PRs in the past 6 months
No closed issues in the past 6 months
No active contributors in the past 6 months
24 open issues with no resolution activity
maintenance.summary: The conserver package shows clear signs of abandonment with zero maintenance activity across all metrics for the past 6 months.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation provides a good overview of the package's purpose, but lacks clear installation instructions and examples.
concerns: No commits in the past six months, indicating a lack of active development.
A significant number of open issues (20) suggests potential bugs or feature requests that have not been addressed.
Docs: Lack of clear and complete installation instructions and absence of troubleshooting information
Security: Potential environment variable injection in autologin/main.c
High bus factor risk (84% from top contributor)
highlights: Recent merged PRs indicate some level of community contribution and maintenance activity.
Multiple contributors in the past six months suggest a distributed effort to maintain the package.
